questions.question: 1) A country has a trade deficit when the ________.

choices.answer: A) exchange rate of its currency with other currencies is fixed
B) exchange rate of its currency with other currencies is variable
C) value of its exports exceeds the value of its imports
D) value of its imports exceeds the value of its exports

questions.question: 2) Which is an indicator of international trade and shows how much is spent on international transactions?
3) Economies of scale are savings from consumers purchasing fewer items at one time.
4) A country that imports more than it exports would have a trade surplus.
5) The number of units to be exchanged for a unit of the second currency is known as the exchange rate of currencies.
6) Which of the following arguments supports the idea of free trade?

choices.answer: A) Dumping rules and tariffs should be stricter in developing countries.
B) International trade takes place without any government interference.
C) Organizations should prefer local workers to home country workers.
D) Local businesses should obtain help from governments.

questions.question: 7) Tariffs are politically motivated restrictions that revoke a company's normal trade relations status.
8) Export subsidies are a form of financial assistance given to exporters.
9) Which of the following is one of the six principles that governs the World Trade Organization's work?

choices.answer: A) Giving preference to trading partners who provide maximum business
B) Protecting domestic industries by offering financial assistance
C) Making trade policies more predictable and transparent
D) Establish dumping procedures to prevent pollution in developed countries
